edge: MOVIES have a SUMMARY associated with them, which is briefly provided to give an idea about the plot and storyline of the movie.

Thunderbirds is a science fiction action-adventure film based on the television series created by Gerry and Sylvia Anderson. In this film, International Rescue (IR), led by widowed former astronaut Jeff Tracy, operates as a secret organisation that aids those in need.
In the film Thunderbirds, Jeff Tracy leads the International Rescue organisation that operates as a secret organisation to aid those in need.

The Hood traps International Rescue (IR) leader Jeff Tracy and four of his sons on board the damaged Thunderbird 5 to steal the other Thunderbirds vehicles and commit heists that IR will be blamed for.
The Hood steals the other Thunderbirds vehicles in the film Thunderbirds to commit heists that International Rescue (IR) will be blamed for.

In the film Thunderbirds, Alan Tracy and his friends Tin-Tin and Fermat stop The Hood who has trapped International Rescue (IR) leader Jeff Tracy and four of his sons on board the damaged Thunderbird 5 to steal the other Thunderbirds vehicles and commit heists that IR will be blamed for.

In the film Thunderbirds, Tin-Tin helps Alan Tracy stop The Hood who has trapped International Rescue (IR) leader Jeff Tracy and four of his sons on board the damaged Thunderbird 5 to steal the other Thunderbirds vehicles and commit heists that IR will be blamed for.

In the film Thunderbirds, Fermat helps Alan Tracy stop The Hood who has trapped International Rescue (IR) leader Jeff Tracy and four of his sons on board the damaged Thunderbird 5 to steal the other Thunderbirds vehicles and commit heists that IR will be blamed for.
The pop-rock band Busted's song 'Thunderbirds Are Go' is featured in the soundtrack of the film Thunderbirds.
In the film Thunderbirds, Jeff Tracy is a widowed former astronaut who leads International Rescue (IR), a secret organisation that operates to aid those in need.

The Hood takes over the island's command center and shuts off power to Thunderbird 5, trapping International Rescue all inside.
The Hood plans to use Thunderbird 2 to rob ten of the world's major banks, thus plunging the international monetary system into chaos, with International Rescue held responsible and disgraced.
Fermat removes Thunderbird 2's guidance chip, delaying the Hood's plan.
Lady Penelope and Parker receive a distress signal from Tracy Island and fly there in FAB 1, where they engage the Hood's minions in combat.
The Hood threatens to hurt Alan's captured friends.
Alan complies and gives up the guidance chip in response to The Hood's threats.
Alan and company are locked in the compound's walk-in freezer by The Hood.
The Hood reveals that during one of International Rescue's first operations, Jeff abandoned him in a collapsing illegal diamond mine, but rescued his half-brother, Kyrano.

Thunderbirds was the third theatrical release based upon the series created by Gerry and Sylvia Anderson.

Production of the film started in the mid-1990s when PolyGram Filmed Entertainment purchased the rights to the entire ITC Entertainment library, which included the original Thunderbirds series. Seeing the big-screen potential of the
faithful director of the Thunderbirds series, Peter Hewitt was signed on to direct the movie adaptation.

faithful writer of the Thunderbirds series, Karey Kirkpatrick was signed on to write the movie adaptation. Although he was not a lifelong fan of the series, Kirkpatrick watched all 32 episodes of the original series to immerse himself within the lore of the series.
in the movie adaptation, The Hood tries to steal Tracy Island's power core to power a device controlled by arch villain Thaddeus Stone.
in the movie adaptation, The Hood tries to steal Tracy Island's power core from Tracy Island.
in the movie adaptation, The Hood's plan involves transferring all of Earth's gravity to the moon with the help of arch villain Thaddeus Stone.
Jonathan Frakes replaced Peter Hewitt as director due to his dislike for the new direction the film was taking.

In Bill Paxton's preparation for his role in the film, he invited Alan (played by Harry Potter actor Rupert Grint), Jeff (played by Luke Skywalker actor Mark Hamill), and three other actors to a meal. Paxton called this experience empowering and said it helped him know Jeff better. This event further strengthens the relationship between these two characters.
In the movie, Alan's school is shown as Wharton Academy. The filming for this scene took place at Wellington College in Berkshire.
The exterior of Lady Penelope's mansion is shown as Cliveden House in the movie. This location was chosen for its grandeur and beauty.
In the movie, the exterior of the Bank of London is shown as University College London. The filmmakers chose this location due to its distinctive architecture.
The Thunderbirds fleet in the film has been redesigned compared to the original series.
Tracy Island in the film has been redesigned compared to the original series.
The International Rescue uniforms in the film have been redesigned compared to the original series.
In the film, Tracy Island is named in dialogue whereas it was not explicitly mentioned in the original series.

In the film, International Rescue is now referred to as 'Thunderbirds' by the general public whereas it was not explicitly mentioned in the original series.

edge: In the film, Onaha is a new character conceived specifically for this movie and takes over Grandma Tracy's role from the original series.
In the film, Tin-Tin's nationality is changed to Indian whereas she was originally from Malaysia in the original series.
The events of the film are taking place in March 2020 according to working trailers. This contradicts StudioCanal's website and other promotional materials that suggest a setting in then.
The setting of the original series is 2026, which impacts merchandise. This fact repeats enough times to affect the ages of the Tracy brothers in the film if their setting is taken as 2026.
According to StudioCanal's website, the events of the film take place then.
The ages of the Tracy brothers line up if the setting is taken as March 2020.
If the setting of the original series is taken as 2026, then the ages of the Tracy brothers indeed line up with the events of the film.
The Thunderbirds movie was a box office bomb, grossing $28,283,637 worldwide against an estimated $57 million budget.
Frakes attributed the film's commercial failure to a combination of stiff competition from Shrek 2 and Spider-Man 2.
The Thunderbirds movie received negative reviews, with those familiar with the series tending to be more negative.

She expressed a far different opinion to that of her former husband, stating 'I felt that I'd been on a wonderful Thunderbirds adventure.' This shows that the character associated with 'Thunderbirds' brought her personal joy and excitement.

She stated, 'I'm personally thrilled that the production team have paid us the great compliment of bringing to life our original concept for the big screen.' This indicates that the character associated with 'Thunderbirds' was happy with the new version of the concept created by the production team.

Colenso, who moved to a career as a communications expert, often describes himself as a 'Former Thunderbird'. The creation of a 60-foot model of Thunderbird 3 for marketing the film is attributed to communication experts at ZenithOptimedia. This highlights Colenso's association with the film and his later career in communications.

The 60-foot model of Thunderbird 3, based on Dominic Lavery's design for the film, was displayed in Trafalgar Square close to the film's release. This shows the promotional efforts made for the film in the iconic location.

The model of Thunderbird 3, based on Dominic Lavery's design for the film, was displayed in Blackpool. This indicates that the promotional efforts made for the film were not limited to London and extended to other locations.

At one point, the model of Thunderbird 3 based on Dominic Lavery's design for the film was decorated with images from Pablo Picasso's Guernica in Blackpool. This highlights the creative elements used to promote the film.

In early 2008, the model of Thunderbird 3 based on Dominic Lavery's design for the film was purchased by Eastern Airways. This shows that the promotional efforts made for the film had a lasting impact.
